block.p: The final report on Hillary Rodham Clinton's behavior in the 1993 dismissal of White House travel office employees was released and it showed that Robert W. Ray, the independent counsel, believed her claim to have had little involvement was ''factually false.'' But he said there was insufficient evidence to bring criminal charges for perjury or obstruction of justice.

The final report on Hillary Rodham Clinton's behavior in the 1993 dismissal of White House travel office employees was released and it showed that Robert W. Ray, the independent counsel, believed her claim to have had little involvement was ''factually false.'' But he said there was insufficient evidence to bring criminal charges for perjury or obstruction of justice.
Mrs. Clinton, who is running for the Senate in New York, complained again that the seven-year investigation was a partisan-inspired waste of money.
